episodeTitle: Jaya, City of Gold in the Sky! Head for God's Shrine!
description: The Straw Hat crew reunites at the sacrificial altar in Upper Yard after their separate trials. Nami reveals that Upper Yard is actually the missing half of Jaya that was launched into the sky. The crew realizes that the legendary City of Gold, Shandora, is real and located on this sky island. Meanwhile, the Shandia warriors launch their attack on Upper Yard to reclaim their homeland.

events.title: Luffy's Group Reaches the Grassland of Skulls
events.description: After escaping the Ordeal of Balls, Luffy, Sanji, and Usopp find themselves in a vast grassland filled with skulls, evidence of countless casualties in Upper Yard.
events.significance: Demonstrates the dangerous nature of Upper Yard and foreshadows the long conflict between the Shandia and the Sky Priests.

events.title: Shandia Warriors Attack Upper Yard
events.description: The Shandia warriors, led by their chiefs, launch a full-scale assault on Upper Yard to reclaim their ancestral homeland from Enel and the Sky Priests. This marks the beginning of the war for Skypiea.
events.significance: Initiates the major conflict of the Skypiea arc, bringing together all the factions (Straw Hats, Shandia, Sky Priests, and Enel) into a complex battle for Upper Yard.

events.title: Wyper Confronts the Straw Hats
events.description: Wyper appears before Luffy's group in the skull grassland. Recognizing him as one of the guerrillas who attacked them upon arrival, the crew is on guard. Wyper declares his intent to defeat Enel and warns the Straw Hats not to interfere.
events.significance: Establishes Wyper's role as a major player in the Skypiea conflict and reveals that the Shandia are also enemies of Enel, setting up potential alliances and conflicts.

quotes.text: I will kill Enel, and if you get in my way, I'll kill you too!
quotes.speaker: Wyper

events.title: Luffy Challenges Wyper
events.description: Angered by Wyper's attack on his crew and his threatening attitude, Luffy challenges Wyper to a fight. However, Wyper departs, commenting that the Straw Hats may not even survive the island.
events.significance: Sets up future confrontation between Luffy and Wyper, while showing Wyper's dismissive attitude toward outsiders.

events.title: Luffy's Group Encounters Sky Sharks
events.description: As Luffy, Sanji, and Usopp continue their journey on the Milky Road toward the sacrificial altar, they are attacked by Sky Sharks. Luffy defeats them using Gomu Gomu no Gatling Gun.
events.significance: Shows the dangerous wildlife of Skypiea and demonstrates Luffy's fighting prowess.

events.title: Straw Hat Crew Reunification
events.description: After being separated through various ordeals, the entire Straw Hat crew finally reunites at the sacrificial altar. Both groups are relieved to find each other safe, though Chopper is shaken from his encounter with Shura.
events.significance: Brings the crew back together so they can share information and plan their next move. This reunion allows them to piece together the truth about Upper Yard.

events.title: Revelation: Jaya Rose to the Sky
events.description: Nami, Zoro, and Robin explain their major discovery: the island of Jaya did not sink 400 years ago as believed, but was instead launched into the sky by a Knock Up Stream. Upper Yard is the missing half of Jaya, complete with its native creatures who adapted to the sky.
events.significance: This revelation connects the Jaya arc to the Skypiea arc, validates Mont Blanc Noland's logbook, and explains the geological mystery that has persisted for 400 years. It also vindicates the Montblanc family's belief.

quotes.text: Jaya didn't sink to the bottom of the ocean... it rose to the sky!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Explaining the crew's discovery about Upper Yard's true origin

events.title: Discovery of Shandora: The City of Gold
events.description: Through combining their knowledge, the Straw Hats realize that the legendary City of Gold mentioned in Noland's logbook is real and located on Upper Yard. By matching Jaya's and Skypiea's maps together, they form a skull shape, with the city located in the skull's right eye as described in the logbook.
events.significance: Confirms that the City of Gold (Shandora) exists and is the true goal. This validates Noland's story completely and provides the crew with a concrete treasure to pursue on the island.

quotes.text: According to Noland's logbook, the city of gold was in the skull's right eye!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Explaining how the maps of Jaya and Skypiea form a skull shape

events.title: Introduction to Mantra
events.description: The crew discusses the mysterious power called Mantra that the priests possess, which allows them to predict movements and read minds. They realize this ability makes the priests formidable opponents.
events.significance: Introduces the concept of Mantra (later revealed to be Observation Haki) to both the crew and audience, establishing it as a major power system in the world of One Piece.

events.title: Straw Hats Decide to Steal the Gold
events.description: After learning about the City of Gold and the ongoing conflict, the crew decides their course of action: they will steal the gold from Shandora before returning to the Blue Sea. Nami is particularly enthusiastic about this plan.
events.significance: Establishes the crew's goal for the remainder of the Skypiea arc and shows their pirate nature - they're interested in the treasure regardless of the political conflicts around them.

events.title: Chopper Treats Gan Fall
events.description: Chopper provides medical care to the injured Gan Fall, who had been defeated by Shura. The crew learns more about Gan Fall's history and his perspective on the conflict in Skypiea.
events.significance: Shows Chopper's role as the crew's doctor and develops Gan Fall as an ally. This interaction helps the crew understand the complex political situation in Skypiea.

events.title: Campfire Reunion and Feast
events.description: The reunited Straw Hat crew celebrates by cooking and eating barbecued Sky Sharks around a campfire, sharing stories of their separate adventures in Upper Yard. The crew bonds over food and discusses their discoveries.
events.significance: Provides a character moment showing the crew's camaraderie and resilience. Despite the dangers they've faced, they can still enjoy each other's company and celebrate their reunion.

quotes.text: Jaya didn't sink to the bottom of the ocean... it rose to the sky!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Major revelation about Upper Yard's origin

quotes.text: According to Noland's logbook, the city of gold was in the skull's right eye!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Discovering the location of the City of Gold

quotes.text: I will kill Enel, and if you get in my way, I'll kill you too!
quotes.speaker: Wyper
quotes.context: Wyper's declaration to the Straw Hats

themes.description: The episode validates Mont Blanc Noland's 400-year-old story about the City of Gold, showing that he was telling the truth all along. This theme explores how truth persists even when dismissed as lies.
themes.symbolism: The skull formation created by combining the maps of Jaya and Skypiea represents how separated pieces of truth can be reunited to reveal the complete picture.

themes.description: The Shandia's attack on Upper Yard represents their struggle to reclaim their ancestral homeland, taken from them 400 years ago. Their determination shows the importance of cultural identity and homeland.
themes.symbolism: Upper Yard itself symbolizes stolen heritage - physically ripped from its original location and claimed by others.

themes.description: The crew's reunion and pooling of information demonstrates how collaboration and communication lead to greater understanding. Each group's separate experiences contribute to the full picture.
themes.symbolism: The campfire gathering represents unity, warmth, and the sharing of stories - a classic bonding moment.

characterSpotlights.development: Nami takes center stage in explaining the geographical mystery of Jaya and Upper Yard, demonstrating her expertise as a navigator. Her excitement about finding the City of Gold shows her treasure-loving nature.
keyActions: Explains that Jaya rose to the sky
Pieces together the map to locate the City of Gold
Convinces the crew to pursue the treasure
quotes: Jaya didn't sink to the bottom of the ocean... it rose to the sky!
According to Noland's logbook, the city of gold was in the skull's right eye!

characterSpotlights.development: Wyper is established as a formidable warrior with a single-minded goal: defeating Enel. His confrontation with the Straw Hats shows his ruthless determination and willingness to eliminate anyone who interferes.
keyActions: Confronts Luffy's group in the skull grassland
Declares his intent to kill Enel
Leads the Shandia attack on Upper Yard
quotes: I will kill Enel, and if you get in my way, I'll kill you too!

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy shows his leadership by bringing his group safely through the Ordeal of Balls and reuniting with the rest of his crew. His challenge to Wyper demonstrates his protective nature toward his crew.
keyActions: Defeats Sky Sharks with Gomu Gomu no Gatling Gun
Challenges Wyper after he threatens the crew
Reunites with his crew at the sacrificial altar

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the scene of Luffy's group traveling on the Milky Road and their encounter with Sky Sharks, which is briefer in the manga.
The campfire scene with the crew eating barbecued Sky Shark is expanded in the anime compared to the manga, providing more character interaction moments.

trivia.fact: This episode is based on Chapter 252 of the manga, titled 'Junction,' which refers to Upper Yard being joined with Jaya.
The episode achieved a 10.7% TV rating in Japan, ranking 5th for its time slot.
An animation error occurs in this episode where Luffy's chin appears uncolored in one scene.
This episode marks a crucial turning point in the Skypiea arc, as it's when all the pieces of the puzzle come together for both the audience and the Straw Hats.
The revelation about Jaya rising to the sky resolves one of the series' major mysteries that was set up during the Jaya arc (episodes 141-152).
